creator: nettings@apache.org
text:
currently, the revision control data is stored in the webapp directory tree,
which leads to loss of revision control information if people who are using
content-dir and ac-repo redirection assume they have got all their important
data in a safe place.

creator: andreas@apache.org
text:
Maybe we should just store the revision control data together with the actual
content?

Something like

23f4w4wf-w4f4wf-6e6he6h/
  en/
    revisions.rcml   - revision history
    1                - revision 1
    2                - ...
    3
    ...

This would require to read the revision control data to get the number of the
latest revision, maybe we should call this one "current" for performance reasons.

that sounds good. i'd love to see this fixed quickly, because complicates
deployment a lot.

we should keep in mind to eventually get rid of the "live" content storage and
just tag a particular published revision as "live".
creator: nettings@apache.org
andreas@apache.org
text:
The revision control data are now stored together with the "actual" content.

It might seem odd that there are also revision data in the live directory, but
this is normal since live documents are changed when something is published.
We'll get rid of that when the live version is just a particular revision.
